thinking.disposable_income: West Lawn is a middle-class community with median household income around $54,000. Many residents work in service and industrial sectors. The community has moderate disposable income but is price-sensitive to transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have modest discretionary spending capacity. Higher sales taxes would impact household budgets. The community has significant retail activity along major corridors, making sales tax impacts relevant
thinking.accessibility: The area has moderate transit access with CTA buses but no rail service. Car ownership is high with most households having 1-2 vehicles. Many residents commute by car to jobs throughout the region. The community needs balanced transportation options
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize proposals with lower sales tax (0.5-1.0%) to protect discretionary spending. 2. Moderate driving fees ($0.50) acceptable to improve transit while not overly burdening car-dependent residents. 3. Lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) preferred to keep transit affordable. 4. Balance between car and transit travel times important given mixed-mode usage. 5. Selected proposals that optimize these factors while maintaining reasonable service levels
